Key Arguments: The legislation will end free speech on digital platforms, allowing only government-approved views.
The bill will stifle the free flow of ideas and necessary debate for human progress.
A small group of bureaucrats will decide what is true or false, reflecting government biases.
The legislation will enshrine the suppression of dissenting expert opinions, particularly in fields like medicine.
Historical examples of misinformation claims that were later proven true are cited to argue against the bill.
The legislation is compared to practices in totalitarian regimes like China and North Korea.
Notable Quotes: If this Bill is passed, it will mean the end of free speech on digital platforms.
Under this legislation a handful of bureaucrats would get to decide what is true or false.
This proposed legislation is itself a grave threat to the 'safety and wellbeing of Australians, as well as to our democracy, society and economy'.
It is a cynical ploy to control the information that Australians receive - to ensure that they only receive information that supports and promotes the Government's agenda.
